summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from September 2005 discussing a proposed $50 million investment opportunity involving jet fuel production and a contract with Delta. William Mook pitches the deal to Ed Razek, asking him to gauge interest from Jeffrey Epstein or others. The email outlines financial projections and finder's fee arrangements.

persons.name: William Mook
persons.context: Author of the forwarded email pitching a $50 million investment opportunity involving jet fuel production and a Delta contract. He represents Mok Industries, LLC and CHW, Inc.

persons.name: Ed Razek
persons.context: Primary recipient of the forwarded email from William Mook. The email asks him to gauge interest in the investment opportunity from Jeffrey Epstein or others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named by William Mook as a person whose interest in a $50 million jet fuel investment opportunity should be gauged by Ed Razek.

connections.description: Mook is pitching a business/investment opportunity to Razek via email, seeking to connect with potential investors.
Mook's email assumes Razek has a connection to Epstein, asking him to gauge Epstein's interest in the investment deal.

events.title: Investment Pitch Email Sent
events.description: William Mook sends an email to Ed Razek pitching a $50 million investment opportunity involving jet fuel production and a contract with Delta, asking him to gauge interest from Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: In September 2005, William Mook contacted Ed Razek to pitch a $50 million investment opportunity, specifically asking Razek to gauge interest from Jeffrey Epstein.
The proposed deal involved selling discounted jet fuel from a production schedule, with Merrill Lynch and Delta mentioned as involved parties.
The email outlines ambitious financial projections, claiming a $50 million investment could net $1.8 billion in less than three years and references a Delta contract worth nearly $18 billion.
The correspondence suggests Epstein was seen by business associates as a potential source of or conduit for large-scale investment capital.
